metadata.title: CVE-2024-35898 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: Fix potential data-race in __nft_flowtable_type_get()nft_unregister_flowtable_type() within nf_flow_inet_module_exit() canconcurrent with __nft_flowtable_type_get() within nf_tables_newflowtable().And thhere is not any protection when iterate over nf_tables_flowtableslist in __nft_flowtable_type_get(). Therefore, there is pertentialdata-race of nf_tables_flowtables list entry. Use list_for_each_entry_rcu()to iterate over nf_tables_flowtables list in __nft_flowtable_type_get(),and use rcu_read_lock() in the caller nft_flowtable_type_get() to protectthe entire type query process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1').
